page.title: 05MELSONBY-The Leek/Onion Club
page.content: The{Black Bull Leek & Onion Club}has been in existence since{1979.}Its {20 or so{members} grow giant leeks and onions competitively.{Each year}since then, on the {second Sunday } in {September,}they hold their {show}when an {independent judge} measures the volume of each members pair of leeks and assesses their condition, shape & quality and then places them in order of merit for prize winning. Onion pairs are similarly judged and placed in order of merit. {Every entrant receives either{a prize or voucher ranging in{value}from about{ Â£125}for the 1st. placed to{ Â£20}for the last placed. Money for these prizes is raised partly from members subscriptions but mainly from weekly raffles and meat draws. {All the leeks and onions must {have been grown in Melsonby gardens.
